title: What is File Bro?
content: File Bro is an Android app that allows users to share files with other devices on the same Wi-Fi network using a web browser.

title: How do I start sharing files with File Bro?
content: Open the File Bro app, select a folder on your device to share, and the app will serve the folder as a web page. Enter the IP address shown in the app into a web browser on any device connected to the same Wi-Fi network.

title: Can other users upload files to my device?
content: Yes, other users can upload files to your Android device using the web page served by File Bro.

title: How do other users upload files?
content: Users can upload multiple files using the upload button on the web page or simply by dragging and dropping them onto the page.

title: Can I view thumbnails for images on the web page?
content: Yes, the web page provides thumbnails for images stored on your Android device.

title: Can I navigate through folders using the web page?
content: Yes, clicking on folders in the web page will take you into the folder to view the files within.

title: Is File Bro secure?
content: File Bro allows sharing within a local Wi-Fi network. Ensure you are connected to a trusted network to maintain security.

title: Do I need an internet connection to use File Bro?
content: No, File Bro works over a local Wi-Fi network and does not require an internet connection.

title: Can I share any type of file with File Bro?
content: Yes, you can share any type of file stored in the selected folder on your Android device.

title: Is there a limit to the number of files I can upload?
content: There is no specific limit to the number of files you can upload, but it may be constrained by your device's storage capacity.

title: How do I stop sharing files?
content: To stop sharing files, simply clicking the stop share button.

title: Can I share files with devices running different operating systems?
content: Yes, as long as the device has a web browser and is connected to the same Wi-Fi network, it can access the files.

title: What should I do if the IP address doesn't work?
content: Ensure both devices are connected to the same Wi-Fi network. Restart the File Bro app and re-enter the IP address shown in the app.

title: How can I change the folder I'm sharing?
content: Click stop sharing button, then select a different folder to share.

title: Can I share subfolders within the selected folder?
content: Yes, subfolders will also be accessible through the web page.

title: Does File Bro support password protection for shared folders?
content: Currently, File Bro does not support password protection for shared folders. Ensure you are sharing within a trusted network.

title: What file formats are supported for upload?
content: File Bro supports all file formats for upload as long as they are compatible with your Android device.

title: Can multiple users access the shared folder simultaneously?
content: Yes, multiple users can access the shared folder at the same time.

title: What happens if I lose Wi-Fi connection?
content: If the Wi-Fi connection is lost, the file sharing will be interrupted. Reconnect to the Wi-Fi network and restart the app to resume sharing.

title: Does File Bro keep a log of shared files?
content: File Bro does not maintain a log of shared files. For security and privacy, manage your shared files carefully.
